alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:24PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Stevens and southeastern Ferry Counties through 600 PM PDT... At 524 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Chewelah to 21 miles northwest of Deer Park. Movement was northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colville, Chewelah, Kettle Falls, Springdale, Marcus, Addy, Fruitland, Cedonia, Gifford, Orin, Valley, Arden, Evans, Inchelium, Hunters, and Rice. This includes U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 197 and 244. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
